titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John W. Valentine, Indictment
CWG10067

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Warren Equity & Criminal Court February Term 1861
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
vs Indictment for carrying concealed & D W
John W Valentine

This day came the attorney for the commonwealth and the Defendant by his Attorney plead not Guilty and thereupon came the following Jury towit Harden Perkins, Cyrus Shobe, John Tegert, Easton Claypool W J Hobson Joseph Hagerman H P Barnes, A S Marrs Noel Sweeney Wm E Floyd Frederick Potter & John Garrison who were elected tried and sworn to well and truly to try the issue and who having heard the evidence &C. Returned the following verdict towit= "We of the Jury find the within named John W Valentine Guilty of the offense as charged in the within Indictment and assess his fine at Fifty Dollars. Hardin Perkins Foreman" It is therefore adjudged by the court that the Defendant John W Valentine make his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of Fifty Dollars and the Costs herein and May be taken &C.

A Copy
Test
L B Cooke C W C C
File the within in J W Valentines Petition for remission of fine
